events.text: I was right about you, after all.
[color=#ffed29](Oh no.)

Orven Zanry, how did you get into [i]my[/i] office?
Breaking and entering, are we?

events.question: [color=#ffed29](I gotta be at my sharpest for this. Get ready, Orven. He wants to find a reason to fire you.)

events.text: No, sir! I…

You what? I lock my door [b]every night.
There’s no way you could’ve gotten in.
Looks like you’re suspended, Zanry.
Suspended?!

This is a [b]crime[/b].
And I [b]can’t wait[/b] to report it to Avidine.
You can’t be on the premises, criminal. Your sentence will be determined tomorrow, and I’ll be pushing to [b]fire you.
Now get out of my sight, traitor.
[color=#ffed29](Oh my gods, what did I just do?)

[color=#ffed29](I didn’t break in, and the lock is perfectly intact.)
[color=#ffed29](So, how should I say I got into Mr. Gungand’s office?)

events.question: [color=#ffed29](I gotta be careful because how I say I got in will point to who helped me.)

events.text:
I didn’t break in, Mr. Gungand.
I used a master key.
It’s unsafe to only have one key to a door, in case of emergencies.
…So you had an accomplice.

It’s your friend, Langtree—she let you in.
She’s the only one you’re close to who has that key.

Well, I told her explicitly that she isn’t to come into my office or to have anyone else enter it.
So she’ll be punished for that.
[color=#ffed29](No! I’m so sorry, Mrs. Langtree.)

And YOU.   
Looks like you’re suspended, Zanry.
Suspended?!

You might not have broken and entered, but this is all confidential and highly suspicious.
And I [b]can’t wait[/b] to report it to Avidine.

events.question: [color=#ffed29](This guy! What should I do? Did I actually do anything wrong??)

events.text:
No words, huh?
The mark of the guilty.

I don’t want to add any words for you to twist when you talk to Mr. Avidine.
That’s all.
I don’t need your words.
You can’t be on the premises, criminal. Your sentence will be determined tomorrow, and I’ll be pushing to [b]fire you.
I’ll add a B&E to your “breaching contract” and “leaking confidential information to the public.”
I don’t even know what you’re talking about??
Yesterday, you stole the [b]Remedium[/b] Review and showed non-factory workers the results.
[color=#ffed29](What?? Is he talking about the Jones brothers?)
[color=#ffed29](THEY WROTE IT??)
Now get out of my sight, traitor.
[color=#ffed29](Oh my gods, what just happened?!)
You’re wrong.

Excuse me.
You’re the one in hot water, so I don’t get where this confidence is coming from, KID.
I know I didn’t do anything wrong.

Hah! Yeah?
You’re in my office RIGHT NOW. And you’re pleading innocent?

events.choice: Others have been in your office.

events.text:
Mr. Gungand, you’re acting like me being in your office warrants me getting fired.
But people other than me have been in your office.

It’s an hour after we start working.
Which I believe is an hour after [i]you[/i] start working?
YOU.
And you’re in charge, right? So there’s a lot of stuff you have and know that we need.
That’s why I’m here. And I don’t think Mister Avidine will mind that I was here, let alone [i]fire[/i] me for it.
So, you can suspend me, but I don’t know if Mister Avidine will like having a worker benched for no reason.
Right, Mr. Gungand?

events.choice: I needed to go into your office.

events.text: I needed to go to your office and you weren’t there to open it.
What was so important that it couldn’t have waited for me to get back?!

events.question: [color=#ffed29](Remember, I’m just trying not to get fired…I have to choose the option that will implicate me the LEAST.)

events.text: I’m not sure, Mr. Gungand. I was just told to grab something on your desk.
You [i]were[/i] an hour late, sir—we couldn’t wait forever.
So, I’m just doing my job, because you weren’t here to do yours.
I needed a letter from the apothecaries.
Why would you want to know about the apothecaries?
I didn’t want to know…I just—
The only one who needs to know about the apothecaries is ME. That’s laboratory work, not production.

You messed up, Zanry. That’s out of your jurisdiction.
And the suspension goes into effect NOW. We can’t have anyone snooping where they shouldn’t at work.
Come back tomorrow to see if you still have a job, Zanry.
I’m sure Avidine loves snakes.
[color=#ffed29](This guy!!!)
I’ll add a B&E to your “breaching contract” and “leaking confidential information to the public.”
I don’t even know what you’re talking about??
Yesterday, you stole the [b]Remedium[/b] Review and showed non-factory workers the results.
[color=#ffed29](What?? Is he talking about the Jones brothers?)
[color=#ffed29](THEY WROTE IT??)
Can’t wait to fire you, I’ve been eager since day one.
Now get out of my sight, and get off the premises.
[color=#ffed29](What just happened??)
[color=#ffed29](No! I couldn’t think of anything fast enough.)
Speechless, huh? The mark of the guilty.

You can’t be on the premises, criminal.
Your sentence will be determined tomorrow, and I’ll be pushing to [b]fire you.
I’ll add a B&E to your “breaching contract” and “leaking confidential information to the public.”
I don’t even know what you’re talking about??
Yesterday, you stole the [b]Remedium[/b] Review and showed non-factory workers the results.
[color=#ffed29](What?? Is he talking about the Jones brothers?)
[color=#ffed29](THEY WROTE IT??)
Can’t wait to fire you, I’ve been eager since day one.
Now get out of my sight, and get off the premises.
[color=#ffed29](What just happened??)
[color=#ffed29](No! I couldn’t think of anything fast enough.)
Speechless, huh? The mark of the guilty.

You can’t be on the premises, criminal.
Your sentence will be determined tomorrow, and I’ll be pushing to [b]fire you.
I’ll add a B&E to your “breaching contract” and “leaking confidential information to the public.”
I don’t even know what you’re talking about??
Yesterday, you stole the [b]Remedium[/b] Review and showed non-factory workers the results.
[color=#ffed29](What?? Is he talking about the Jones brothers?)
[color=#ffed29](THEY WROTE IT??)
Can’t wait to fire you, I’ve been eager since day one.
Now get out of my sight, and get off the premises.
[color=#ffed29](What just happened??)

I didn’t break in, Mr. Gungand. I used a spare key.
It’s unsafe to only have one key to a door, in case of emergencies.
Whose spare?
I got permission from Miss Odiche to use it.

Somehow, I doubt that.
ODICHE!

Let’s play a game of chance, Zanry.
And I bet she didn’t ask you to come in.
[color=#ffed29](This is bad.)

What is it now, Sion?
It is far too early to be thundering about!
Orvo? Why are you corresponding with Mr. Gungand?
Ah, so you ARE surprised he’s here.
Naturally, at this hour, you would be assisting young Herb.
How interesting, because Orven said [i]you[/i] had given him permission to enter my office.
How fortuitous, that you have ended up in Sion’s office, Orvo…
You’re suspended, Zanry.
Indeed…I think that to be appropriate.
[color=#ffed29](I don’t even know a way out of this one.)

??????
Hmm…I do not recall sending you here?
A truly confusing scenario, how were you even able to get to the door?
The only solutions are nefarious.
And I’ll be pushing to [b]fire[/b] you.
FIRE?!
We cannot fire someone simply for infiltrating a managerial office!
It’s more than that. He breached his contract and leaked confidential information to the public.
This surely is not true, is it, Orvo?
I don’t even know what he’s talking about??
Yesterday, you stole the [b]Remedium[/b] Review and showed non-factory workers the results.
[color=#ffed29](What?? Is he talking about the Jones brothers?)
[color=#ffed29](THEY WROTE IT??)
Is this true??
I didn’t show anyone who wasn’t working on the project [i]anything!!!
Sion.
I will explain when this [b]traitor[/b] is gone.
Get out of my sight.
…We shall see you tomorrow after deliberations.
Miss Odiche!!! You have to believe me!
Believe the one who just broke into [i]my[/i] office, putting the [i]blame on you?
You know it’s not like that, Miss Odiche!
Is that someone we need on this team?

Please leave, Orvo.
We shall reconvene tomorrow regarding potential termination.
[color=#ffed29](How can this be happening??)

I’m not sure whose spare it is?
I just found the spare.
Where.
I’m not sure, somewhere unimportant, no doubt.
Give it to me.
[color=#ffed29](I can’t!)
I don’t have it anymore. I put it back where I found it.
Which is??
Can’t remember.
If you came earlier, you definitely would’ve seen me put it back and could’ve gotten the spare key.
But it’s not like you’re getting paid to be here an hour earlier, right?
[color=#ffed29](No! I couldn’t think of anything fast enough.)
Speechless, huh? The mark of the guilty.

You can’t be on the premises, criminal.
Your sentence will be determined tomorrow, and I’ll be pushing to [b]fire you.
I’ll add a B&E to your “breaching contract” and “leaking confidential information to the public.”
I don’t even know what you’re talking about??
Yesterday, you stole the [b]Remedium[/b] Review and showed non-factory workers the results.
[color=#ffed29](What?? Is he talking about the Jones brothers?)
[color=#ffed29](THEY WROTE IT??)
Can’t wait to fire you, I’ve been eager since day one.
Now get out of my sight, and get off the premises.
[color=#ffed29](What just happened??)
I didn’t break in.
How’d you get in, then?!

I don’t know.
But I didn’t break in. You can check the lock, there’s no tampering or anything.
You’re being my least favorite kind of annoying: where you’re playing stupid by being a smart ass.

Sorry, sir, I’m not trying to be annoying.
I’m just not really sure I can tell you how this happened.
And I’m “just not really sure” how [b]stupid[/b] you think [b]I am.

events.choice: The door was open when I got there.

events.text: The door was open when I got here.
Impossible, Zanry, I lock it every night.
Well, I’m not saying you didn’t, sir, I’m just saying someone opened it before I got here.
I know you did it.
And I’m telling you I didn’t.
Alright, then, who opened it?
Well, I have no idea about that. I just saw it open.
And I “have no idea” how [b]stupid[/b] you think [b]I am.

Oh no! It’s not you who’s stupid, sir, I would never.
I’m the stupid one, as I’m the one that can’t remember.
It’s not going to work, Zanry, I know you’re not this dumb…
...Unlike your friend, Tamboor.
[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]What.
There you are, was wondering when the act would drop.
But yeah, if Tamboor had said all that, I wouldn’t have bat an eye, the idiot he is.

[b]Herb isn’t an idiot.
He’s one of the best glassblowers you’ve GOT.
Come on, let’s use [i]our brains.

events.question: [color=#ffed29](He’s baiting me. But I can’t let him talk about Herb like this?!)

events.text:
We’re done here.
I didn’t break in, you can’t prove either way, and I’m not going to listen to you talk bad about one of the best production workers you have.

Oh, but [b]I’m[/b] your superior.
[b]I dismiss you.

Not when you talk badly about your employees to other employees.
You’re not a manager, you’re [i]scum.

......
…Did you call me…[i]scum.
That’s [b]bold[/b] coming from you, [b]Zanry.
[b]Apologize[/b], maggot.
You’re SCUM for talking about HERB LIKE THAT!
Take it back.
Ordering [i]me[/i], now?
[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1][b]Take it back.
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]Tamboor is an [i]idiot. Who will [i]rot[/i] as [i]my employee[/i] for [i]his whole life.

[color=#ffed29](He’s baiting me. He wants me to hit him.)
[color=#ffed29](He’s trying to get me fired.)
[color=#ffed29](But I’m [shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1][b]SO MAD.[/b][/shake])

Not going for it, huh?
Just gonna let me say all these things about Tamboor?
What a friend you are.
[b]You’re not worth it.
That’s [b]bold[/b] coming from you, [b]Zanry.
[color=#ffed29](Looks like he’s the one being baited.)
You’re a waste of time.
[b]Apologize.
NEVER.
[color=#ffed29](No! I couldn’t think of anything fast enough.)
Speechless, huh? The mark of the guilty.

You can’t be on the premises, criminal.
Your sentence will be determined tomorrow, and I’ll be pushing to [b]fire you.
I’ll add a B&E to your “breaching contract” and “leaking confidential information to the public.”
I don’t even know what you’re talking about??
Yesterday, you stole the [b]Remedium[/b] Review and showed non-factory workers the results.
[color=#ffed29](What?? Is he talking about the Jones brothers?)
[color=#ffed29](THEY WROTE IT??)
Can’t wait to fire you, I’ve been eager since day one.
Now get out of my sight, and get off the premises.
[color=#ffed29](What just happened??)

Hahaha!
Zanry, you’re a pain in my side, through and through.
[color=#ffed29](Why is he laughing???)

Well, I guess I can’t fire you for being in my office.
But you know what I can fire you for?
[i]WHAM!
[color=#ffed29](He hit his head with a lamp???)
HELP!!!
You’re fired for violence and insubordination, Zanry.

?!
I didn’t touch you!!!

Really? Well, it’s your word against mine.
And I’m sure your prints are all over this room.
THIS IS CRAZY!
What is the meaning of this??
Orven!
He ASSAULTED ME!
I didn’t touch him!!! He did this to himself!
Why would I do that??
TO FRAME ME.
You guys GOTTA BELIEVE ME!

Odiche, you must fire him!
This is violence [i]and[/i] insolence!!!
[color=#ffed29](He’s trying to get Miss Odiche to fire me so it’s less obvious he did this to himself!)

Orven wouldn’t hurt a fly!
There must be a mistake!

Miss Odiche, PLEASE, you have to listen to me!!!
Does this sound like anything I would do??
Miss Odiche, you KNOW me, does this sound anything like me??

I…understand your plea.
Indeed, this would be highly irregular of you.
ODICHE.
We can’t have the press leaking this. We must fire him swiftly.
Press?! Why would the press be involved?
Sion...
Let’s not have the press be involved, right?
Orven Zanry…

Miss Odiche, you know he’s making this all up!!!
And now he’s threatening you!!! You can’t side with him!!!
This wound is [i]very real[/i].

Odiche, do you want [b]Remedium[/b] to fail??
Another failure to add to your sorry life?
Miss Odiche, please.

[i]sigh
I’m sorry.
Regrettably, the Avidine factory must terminate your employment henceforth.
Please leave the premises.
NO!!!
What if [i]I[/i] leak that Orven was framed??
Do you want to be fired too, Tamboor?
Don’t, Herb…it’s okay.
It isn’t?! How is any of this okay?!
Leave it alone…I’ll figure it out.
I…I’ll leave with you!

HAH! Go ahead.
That’s two birds with one stone for me.

Stay, Herb…You’re a gifted glassblower.
There aren’t that many opportunities for that around here.

But…But I’m your friend.
And this isn’t right!?

Please.
For me, stay.
I’ll figure something out.
Orven, no…

…...
Truly regrettable.
